Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but dark room and away from the centre.”
Reviews.Author: Steven A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Front desk was friendly and efficient. The single room was quite small and dark with brown curtains and brown bedspread, a different colour would have been better. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was powerful. The room seemed overpriced but I suppose accommodation in Barcleona is expensive. Location was away from the city centre so I found myself staying near the hotel in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer services”
Reviews.Author: alex s
Reviews.Content: i have just come back from taking a client on a anual holiday and the hotel staff were amazing really helpful and they made sure our rooms were cleaned daily also the rooms were very spacious and comfortable will definatly stay here again and also very disabled friendly

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: AyeshaY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicer then I expected compared to the pictures. The staff was lovely and very helpful with tourist information. However, the beds weren't the most comfortable and the rooms where not soundproof at all! However the variety of channels on the TV in the room where good, and tea and coffee was available in the room. BUT wifi was only accessible in the lobby, not in the rooms. The hotel was a 10 minute walk to La Sagrada Familia which was excellent as we could hop on the Barcelona city bus and go to La Rambla and other places from there. There are also lots of convenience stores and cafes/patisseries right next to the hotel, and a bank if you need to get some money. All in all was a pleasant stay and would defiantly come back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “christmas break”
Reviews.Author: NlincsLindy
Reviews.Content: used this hotel for 'overspill' of a family christmas break, therefore only used hotel for breakfast(as part of package) , siesta for a couple of hours and for night sleeping.Very handy for 2 metro stations, tram stop and buses; could also catch 'El Prat' airport bus outside the hotel. Little supermarket for essentials, 2 bread shops, 3 cafes etc all within 2 minutes. In the foyer/reception area there is ice machine, snack and drinks machine. The staff were friendly and helpful. For first 4 nights very quiet. Hotel is being refurbished so there was some hammering which started at 08.30 on the last 3 mornings of our stay (people have to work!) One night, we returned quite late because of babysitting grandchildren and the whole of reception area was being painted. Next morning it was back to its purpose without any remains of the painters except for a fresh look! On final night there was partying in the next room but when we went to reception they dealt with it immediately. Anything extra we asked for, eg pillows, was provided within 5 minutes. Breakfast provided more food then we needed and the waitress worked efficiently in a courteous way. Cleaniness was excellent with cloths changed after every person breakfasting. Room was quite adequate for what we needed. Always lots of hot water at all times with good pressure. Tioletries and towels provided everyday. I even think that bed linen was changed every day or the beds were made so well that it seemed they were! All in all an acceptable stay and very close to our family's apartment, so , if we need to , we would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, A bit old, tiny bathroom. The location is good”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights starting August 16, 2011. The location is good, it is actually not very far from the commercial centre. you can either walk, or take a bus. I have tried both. I will take a bus if i have bought something, but walk if I'm empty hands. And the commercial centre is actually close to all main sight. i have got a single room. The hotel is old. The interior of the room is like some 80's/early 90's style. Dark lighting. Tiny bathroom... Great wireless access. The best that i have in Spain. Hmm, pretty much that it. The hotel is alright, average, but i will not go back again.

Reviews.Title: “oldish and far away”
Reviews.Author: apalmero
Reviews.Content: Not the best deal in town. Rooms badly need refurbishment and its location is not great, ad far from the center (1/2 hour walk). When I went thewre, it wasn't cheap either. There are better deals in town.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: STEVE222LONDON
Reviews.Content: Booked a non basement room, got a basement room, very sparsely furnished, no drawer space at all. The main light switch was firmly against the bed and turned on and off as you turned over in the bed. There were only two very flat pillows so we requested some more,. The night Porter said there were no spares, so we had to roll up a dirty blanket that was in the wardrobe. The safe didn't work and they tried different cards without success, said they would get an engineer to sort it out and didn't. There was no plug in the sink and the bath wouldn't fill without the shower coming on, and the grouting around the bath was old and gungy. We wanted a drink when coming home from the football at half past twelve but the bar was closed and the Night Porter wouldn't open it. We decided to have a beer from the Mini bar ( very aptly named ) but no beer in it ! The breakfast was e10.40 and was acceptable. This was only a three star hotel, but franklythis was the worse I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lala0505
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel , had an excellent stay.great place to stay if your coming from Girona airport.5mins from estacio del nord.very clean option.not alot of restaurants or bars nearby.would recommend to go to a Barcelona game amazing. Las rambles within walking distance about 20mins away.la sagrada familia 5mins walk away same with arc de triumph. Excellent option for prices compared to other options.would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: DoctorAndy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here woth my partner for five nights on a vacation to Barcelona. It comes highly recommended. The staff in this hotel are very friendly and helpful - cannot praise them enough! It is fairly central, maybe 1 miles out of the very centre, and it's near a Metro station, so travelling around is easy enough. I guess I'm only giving this a four star rating ion view of the room. The rooms are good, but not as up-to-date as they might be. Didn't eat at the hotel. There are plenty of cafes and supermarkets nearby, and even the odd restaurant. But I would certainly recommend this hotel, and be happy to stay there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “great mid-range option in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bren53
Reviews.Content: stayed for six nights from 29th december in a single room found hotel to be very clean with an excellent continental buffet breakfast each morning this hotel is well situated about 30 min walk from city centre and seafront hotel can be easily reached by train from airport to clot railway station which is about 15 min walk glories shoping centre is close by also no 7 bus take you into centre in 5 minutes from outside hotel this bus also goes to diagonal mar shoping centre. i would have no hesistation in recommendig this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice value”
Reviews.Author: Sens4life
Reviews.Content: Situated in a nice part of Barcelona, very close to the Glories Tower and the beach is within walking distance, albeit a long walk. The hotel can be easily reached from the Glories or Monumental metro stops. Finding it the first time may be confusing as the streets in Barco aren't always clearly marked, but you'll get the hang of it. There is a handy little supermarket beside the hotel. The free wifi was fast. In my opinion, a perfect option for mid-range accommodation seekers visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: KataComb
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at this hotel. Breakfast is very good, the room was very clean, the staff was decent and english speaking and the location has very good public transport connections. There is a super-market just near the hotel and the nearest subway station is just 3 minutes walk. La Sagrada Familia is just 5 mintes walk. On the down side, if the room you get is facing the street it could be a little bit noisy only if you go to sleep before 10 o'clock, which is not recommended in a city like Barcelona :).

Reviews.Title: “Help”
Reviews.Author: retrohoop
Reviews.Content: Not a pleasant place to stay. Dark dreary and noisy. Every time a door closed in our corridoor it shook the room. The staff at best were functional and all just back from a funeral !! Stay away

Reviews.Title: “Depressing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Ton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Glories Hotel in November 2007. I was booked into the hotel by my employer as I was attending Microsoft TechEd at the convention centre. Checking in seemed efficient although the ‘check in’ staff didn’t seem that friendly. When I got to my room it was tiny and dark. The curtain was fastened to the window and couldn’t be opened. I quickly realised this was because the room looked out into the central fire escape corridor! Unable to spend 7 nights in such a depressing room I went back down to reception and asked to be moved to a room with a window that faced the exterior of the building (not an unreasonable demand in my opinion). I finally got my new room which was exactly the same as the old room but with an outside window. The room had key operated electrics which not only switched off the lights when you left but also the mains electric which included the fridge! The room safe didn’t work and took two days of maintenance man visits to fix. I was able to use safety deposit boxes in reception though. As it was November they had decided to turn off the air conditioning to all rooms regardless of whether you wanted it or not. I had to sleep with the window open which meant I had to put up with car horns and general traffic noise. On the plus side the rooms were clean and the breakfast was nice. The location isn’t that great, it was neither close to the convention centre or the centre of Barcelona. I had to get a tram to both. I would not recommend this hotel, I imagine it was cheap but I didn’t pay for it so I don’t know.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place, Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jazzumbo
Reviews.Content: The room is not a large at all ;-))) but it's nice furbished and clean. Bathroom was well equiped, the AC was working ok. The window was small and covered by a heavy curtain. Nothing to see through the window, anyway (just a grey wall). We have enjoyed the stay, though (holiday travel). The city is absolutely amazing (architecture, events, night life, gastronomy etc) so you don't need to spend too much time in the hotel room. Just sleep, shower and go back to the street. The laundry is not working on Saturdays & Sundays. The breakfast is +++++ (if you are not a vegan, of course:)): a large selection of catalan ham specialities is waiting for you here every morning. However, there is a cool pub just in front of the hotel. It's very catalan (a large selection of tapas, anchovies, bacalao, Estrella Damm bier and a very good & strrrrong expresso) The hotel it's very close to the Monumental de Torros de Barcelona (Bullfight arena). Every Sunday there is a Bullfight show here: if you like this kind of performance you can pay a ticket (from Euro 12 to 20) . If you hate it, you can join the bullfight protesters just in front of the tickets offices ;-))) Other touristic atractions next to hotel: the famous temple of the Sagrada Familia (15 min by walk) and Torre Agbar. Unfortunatelly the hotel is not very close to Placa Catalunya ... but you can manage this by subway or by bus ;-)

Reviews.Title: “money well spent”
Reviews.Author: maggi58
Reviews.Content: Girlie weekend celebrating a 50th Birthday This hotel offered excellent accomodation and was very good value for money. When booking a reservation the staff were very helpful and I felt the Hotel has been previously understated,The accomodation was clean, the breakfast held you in good stead for the day and was varied. I would use this hotel again and would recommend it. Public transport was very accessible and relatively cheap.Barcelona has left me and my friends with very good memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: traveller8686
Reviews.Content: We travelled here for a weekend break to watch the Barcelona match, and stayed for 4 nights, What can I say, I was very impressed, as soon as we arrived at 12pm we were allowed to check in, which is good for a hotel. The staff were very welcoming especially manuel the man of reception, who was a star, especially when we lost our room key. The area was great with a big shopping centre nearby (glories) and also (diagonal) is not that far away. The room was clean and comfy, and the breakfast selection was good and fresh. The Monumental metro station is the nearest and the hotel is easy to find from there. You are only 4 stops from placa da catalunya which is where La Rambla starts, and most of the nightlife happens. If you are looking to book a cheap good value hotel, go here as you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Your money”
Reviews.Author: CrepeBudapest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Glories for 3 nights (parents & 13 yrs old child) Seemed to be quite new, so the room was OK, however with the additional bed for our son the room was quite narrow. The bathroom was also very clean and quite big. The breakfast was OK. The only (and small) minus point is, that hotel is not very close to the centre of Barcelona, but 5 minutes walk to the metro so You can get everywhere. The staff was nice and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs so...distroyed holiday”
Reviews.Author: adri13
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 17th november till 20th of november 2007. It was a horrible experience. In the first morning we woke up with a lot of insects in our bed and marks of blood. We didn't know what kind of insects they were because we've never seen before. They moved us in an other room immediatly. We asked to discuss with the manager but they told us it is not possible because it is sunday. At the end of the day we had the first signs on our skin, more then one hundred of papula and a lot of itch. Next morning we saw a new insect in bed but a lot of new lesions. Again it was not possible to talk with the manager because even though we announced we want to go out after 9 o'clock because we were in holiday he didnt't come. The skin was worse and worse and in the end of the day we go to the doctor. After a new night (yes it was our mistake we didn't move immediatly) in an other hotel) of terror we went again to the doctor and only after we present the report of the doctor the manager came to talk with us. And he told us that we do not have to pay the first night and that they will pay the doctor and the medication. Of course we asked what will happen with our broken holiday, with the risk to carry with us the insects (we discovered meantime they were bed bugs) with the risk to catch some disease but the response was that they evacuated the rooms from that floor and they will make disinsection. After that we moved in another place. So of course they do not carry about our holiday which was a calvaire and about the risk we have to take in our baggages the bed bugs and so to have otherr problems at our return home. We can't understand how it could happen and we do not understand the reaction they had. Now we are back home (just arrived) and we started to look for advices about what we have to do now with our things. The first think to do tomorrow is to go to the doctor to discuss about the risks (instead to go to work ) and what analises we have to do. So we advice you not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and price for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: san1983
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights on Glories Hotel on Venere.com and got a good price for it after the Med. cruise. Did not expect a lot but we were so happy to find a room with connected room for total of 4 beds. Hotel receptionist held our luggages so we could explore the city, got a 2 days ticket for Tour bus Turistic, station was 8 min. walk. The breakfast was excellent, out of our expectation, an online store just opposite of the hotel and it was cheap too. The room with a safe and a fridge. Excellent value, good services.

Reviews.Title: “Far from a 'disaster'”
Reviews.Author: NWandJP
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Glories. This 3* hotel is a 3* hotel! Therefore you get what you pay for and as such we cannot complain. The lift - although small - is not offensive. Our room was spacious and clean. The staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English. We did not opt for the breakfast. However, the supermarket and bakery next door provided adequate morning refreshment and convenient groceries. The location was ideal - walking distance from various tourist attractions, including beautiful beaches, Barcelona zoo, and Gaudi's Cathedral. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a city break in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: irishticket
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not suitable for a relaxing, romantic break as we had intended. The first problem was the lift - there was not enough room for me (small), my husband (tall,blocky) and 1 small suitcase - we had to squash in! We travelled downward to the basement area. Our room was tiny - a very small double bed pushed right up to the ensuite wall. There was a two foot aisle left in the room! The view from the window was diagonally opposite the neighbouring window and was surrounded by a triangular concrete tunnel - there was daylight somewhere at the top! Extremely dungeon like. The ensuite was long and very narrow - bath/shower way too small and quite grubby. The TV had no english channels. The breakfast room has no daylight at all and a very small breakfast buffet. Neither of us are closterphobic but we couldn't wait to get out of there. We ended up walking the legs off ourselves in Barcelona as we couldn't bear to be in the hotel any longer than we absolutely had to. We never thought to try and change the room - looking at the website on our return they obviously have larger rooms available. We couldn't wait to get home and the hotel definitely put a damper on our weekend getaway. Will not be recommending to anyone - unless you're a backpacker and just need somewhere small to lay your head ...

Reviews.Title: “Were positive suprised”
Reviews.Author: dasbastian
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Glories for a few days in early April. For all you who are too lazy to read all this, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's 5 min. from the Monumental (L2) metro station away, located in a small alley aside the 2 main roads nearby, so there is almost no traffic noise. There is a tiny supermarket next to the hotel and some bars+restaurants are in the surrounding. All the main attractions can be reached by foot if you like walking through barcelona (which isn't boring at all). The sagrada familia is only 10 min. away, the beach about 20 min. and Les Rambles 25 min. Breakfast is very good and you can eat until 11 o'clock. I can't say anything about the staff cuz I didn't had any problems or requests. The rooms had an appropriate size, were clean and everything worked fine. But don't expect sea view or a view over the city, you either are going to see a backyard or houses. The only downside is, that we booked a doubleroom but had 2 small beds combined to one instead of one big bed. Uh I forgot, the use of the safe is for free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_and_Steve
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 days in March. It was perfectly located, 5 mins from the Metro. Hotel was immaculate, bathroom was good size with toiletries etc..staff were brilliant, the buffet breakfast was amazing and so cheap! Cafe and mini-market right next door. Shopping Mall 10 mins walk with restaurants, fast food, English and Spanish shops. Close enough to Barcelona without being right in the centre. What more can I say...I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: FiveTimesWinners
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel for price. Requested (indeed booked) a twin room, but was provided with a double. Room clean, but traffic noise at all hours other than between 1am and 5.30am made it difficult to sleep. Whilst not bpthered abut TV, one was in the room but very poor quality as only 3 of the 30 channel had any reception. Location well away from main tourist sights, but well located for Metro.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Glories
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Padilla 173, 08013 Barcelona, Spain
